duties_responsibilities.duty: Perform administration and analysis of WGU’s Compensation programs and work in conjunction with Business leaders and other members of People & Talent to administer, recommend and review compensation policies, procedures & programs at WGU.
Serve as a primary compensation contact for assigned client groups and partner with Talent & Hiring leaders to develop compensation offers.
Conduct job description reviews, including market reviews, and responsible for the job creation process.
Recommend, conduct, and participate in salary surveys to understand competitive compensation levels in the organization.
Communicate and coach business leaders and employees on compensation processes and policies.

Administer merit, annual & market adjustments and assure through audits, analysis, and reports that all organization compensation programs are consistently administered in compliance with company policies and government regulations.
Work on core compensation projects and conduct ad-hoc analysis on compensation policies, procedures, and programs, making recommendations based on market competitiveness and total rewards philosophy.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business, or a related field
